high_consensus.title: Constraint enforcement is documentation, not code
high_consensus.description: PRD assumes programmatic constraint enforcement (isConstructWorkflowActive function). Actual enforcement is through: (1) CLAUDE.md prompt instructions, (2) command pre-flight .md templates, (3) safety hooks. FR-2/FR-3 must specify which layer yielding occurs at.
high_consensus.recommendation: Rewrite FR-2/FR-3 to specify three enforcement layers: constraints.json gets construct_yield field for CLAUDE.md rendering, command .md files get conditional pre-flight checks, hooks unchanged.

high_consensus.title: condense in schema but out of scope
high_consensus.description: FR-1 schema lists condense as gate value but Section 7 marks condense implementation as out of scope. Creates dead value in reader.
high_consensus.recommendation: Remove condense from this cycle's reader. Schema accepts it but treats as full with logged advisory. Full condense behavior deferred to loa-constructs#129.

high_consensus.title: FR-4 assumes CLI flags, skills take sprint IDs
high_consensus.description: FR-4 proposes --criteria-source parameter but review/audit are skill invocations taking sprint IDs, not CLI commands with flags.
high_consensus.recommendation: Replace --criteria-source with construct manifest detection. When review-sprint detects active construct, reads criteria from construct's declared source. No new CLI parameter.

disputed.title: FR-4 scope too large for this cycle
disputed.description: 6+ hard coupling points in review/audit skills. Full decoupling is substantial refactoring.

disputed.title: Data/Lore direct vs required inconsistency
disputed.description: Section 9 shows implement: direct for Data/Lore but schema only allows implement: required.
